text:
WE, THE PEOPLE OF INDIA, having solemnly resolved to constitute India into a 42[SOVEREIGN SOCIALIST SECULAR DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC] and to secure to all its citizens:

JUSTICE, social, economic and political;

LIBERTY of thought, expression, belief, faith and worship;

EQUALITY of status and of opportunity;

and to promote among them all

FRATERNITY assuring the dignity of the individual and the 42[unity and integrity of the Nation];

IN OUR CONSTITUENT ASSEMBLY this twenty-sixth day of November, 1949, do HEREBY ADOPT, ENACT AND GIVE TO OURSELVES THIS CONSTITUTION.
summary:
The resol. on Preamble was passed by the Constituent Assembly on 26th Nov, 1949; i.e. after the rest of the Articles were already passed.

Preamble has been amended just once, via 42nd CAA, 1976.

NCRWC: The lofty ideals in the Preamble express the aspirations of a renascent and rejuvenated India.

Dr BRA: Our political democracy must stand on the base of social democracy, which means a way of life that recognizes Liberty, Equality and Fraternity as the principles of life.

Notably, The US Const of 1789 also begins with the words, 'WE THE PEOPLE'. This emphasises the idea of a unified nation and a democratic Const.

amendments.description: The words 'SOCIALIST' and 'SECULAR' were added by the Indira Gandhi Government. This remains the only instance where the Preamble to Our Constituion was amended.
